data.title: IPU PARLINE database: MALAYSIA (Dewan Rakyat), ELECTIONS IN 2013
data.meta_description: IPU PARLINE database on national parliaments: MALAYSIA (Dewan Rakyat), ELECTIONS IN 2013
data.text:
Purpose of elections The National Front (BN) - a 13-party ruling coalition comprising Prime Minister Najib RazakÂs United Malays National Organization (UMNO) - took 133 seats in the 222-member House of Representatives, down from 140 seats in 2008 and 199 in 2004. The Prime Minister promised to continue his economic policies.

The three-party opposition coalition Pakatan Rakyat (PeopleÂs Alliance, see note), led by former Deputy Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim took the remainder, pledging to end corruption. It won a majority of popular votes, with 51%, reportedly drawing strong support from the Chinese community in urban areas. Mr. Anwar accused the BN of electoral fraud, an accusation denied by the government.

On 6 May, Mr. Najib was sworn in as Prime Minister by King Abdul Halim Mu'adzam Shah and subsequently named a 57-member Cabinet, one of the worldÂs largest.

Note:

The Pakatan Rakyat (PeopleÂs Alliance) comprised the Democratic Action Party (DAP), the People's Justice Party (PKR) and the Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party (PAS). Date of previous elections: 8 March 2008

Date of dissolution of the outgoing legislature: 3 April 2013

Timing of election: Upon normal expiry*

*The term of the members in the outgoing legislature expired on 30 April.

Although the previous elections were held in March 2008, the new elections needed to be called by 2 June 2013 (within 60 days from 3 April).

Expected date of next elections: May 2018

Number of seats at stake: 222 (full renewal)

Number of candidates: 579 (523 men, 56 women)

Percentage of women candidates: 9.7%

Number of parties contesting the election: 4 (one coalition and three parties)

Number of parties winning seats: 4

Alternation of power: No

Number of parties in government: 1 coalition comprising 13 parties

Names of parties in government: National Front (BN)

Date of the first session of the new parliament: 24 June 2013

Name of the new Speaker: Mr. Tan Sri Pandikar Amin Haji Mulia (National Front, BN)
